intro: Anthyllis saharae, commonly known as the Sahara anthyllis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand the harsh conditions of its desert environment. It has small, compound leaves that help reduce water loss, and its root system is capable of fixing nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Anthyllis saharae plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
